text:
On keying, at a big facility no. At small or medium facility then yes. General gist is a soft key for edges, a core key (or rotol to fill the holes. Break different areas into seperate areas ie don't try to grab everything with one key.

There's an excellent keying course by Victor Perez on FXPhd. Thing about keying tutorials though is that the greenscreens are usually way better than the real production ones, so that's where helping on a short film is a good way to get some gnarly greenscreens.
Russel Dodgson, head of Nuke at Framestore advertising once said, "show me three good  keys in a row and I'll give you a job"
